page.title: 02THE DEVIL'S PUNCHBOWL.
page.content: THE MOST NOTABLE FEATURE IN OUR LANDSCAPE IS KNOWN AS THE DEVIL'S PUNCHBOWL.IT IS A HUGE DEPRESSION WHICH HAS BEEN FORMED BY THE EROSIVE EFFECT OF RAIN, SPRINGS AND STREAMS OVER A LONG PERIOD OF TIME, SO THAT THE BASE OF THE BOWL IS 1OO METRES LOWER THAN ITS RIM, AROUND THE EDGE OF WHICH THE LONDON TO PORTSMOUTH ROAD -A3, IS FORCED TO CURL. THE SPRINGS, RISING WHERE THE GREENSAND AND ATHERFIELD CLAY MEET, JOIN TOGETHER TO FORM THE SMALL BROOK, WHICH BECOMES A TRIBUTARY OF THE WEY. THE PUNCHBOWL IS AN AREA OF OUTSTANDING NATURAL BEAUTY AND ALONG WITH GIBBET HILL FORMS PART OF THE HINDHEAD COMMONS UNDER THE OWNERSHIP OF THE NATIONAL TRUST. AS A CONSEQUENCE IT IS MUCH FREQUENTED BY THE PUBLIC FOR RECREATION.
